meanings.definition: To wander from a direct course or at random
meanings.sent1: The lost puppy strayed into the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent2: The hiker strayed off the trail and got lost in the woods.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat strayed into the open window and explored the house.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts strayed from the task at hand, leading to mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The kite strayed far from the child's grasp, dancing in the wind.

meanings.definition: To deviate from the right path or correct way
meanings.sent1: The student strayed from the study plan and struggled with the exam.
meanings.sent2: The driver strayed into the wrong lane and caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel strayed into the bird feeder, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: His mind strayed to memories of childhood, distracting him from work.
meanings.sent5: The arrow strayed off course, missing the target by inches.

meanings.definition: To wander away from a set course or place
meanings.sent1: The ship strayed off course during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The sheep strayed from the flock and had to be herded back.
meanings.sent3: The toddler strayed from the playground and into the sandbox.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze strayed to the window, daydreaming instead of listening.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh bread strayed from the bakery, enticing passersby.
